newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-BLACKBURN PLAY DOWN REPORTED MOVE FOR BEBETO.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-BLACKBURN PLAY DOWN REPORTED MOVE FOR BEBETO.

text.p: Blackburn Rovers, bottom of the English premier league without a win this season, dismissed reports on Tuesday they are interested in buying Brazilian striker Bebeto.
Blackburn chairman Robert Coar stressed there was "nothing doing" in newspaper speculation linking the club with Bebeto, who was an integral part of Brazil's World Cup-winning side in 1994.
"It's just the latest name to be floated across us and that's all it is," added Coar when asked about the prospect of the 32-year-old forward joining Rovers.
British newspapers quoted Blackburn manager Ray Harford as saying: "There is no questioning the fact that he (Bebeto) is a sensational player, one of the best players in the world.
"It seems he is very keen to come to England. He has seen the likes of Juninho do well over here and believes it offers a new challenge."

Newspaper reports said Harford had been contacted by Bebeto's agent and that the player was expected to cost around five million pounds ($8 million) in fees and wages. He moved to Flamengo from Spanish side Deportivo Coruna at the end of last season.
Blackburn are looking for a replacement for England striker Alan Shearer, who was sold to Newcastle United for a world record 15 million pounds sterling ($24 million) just before the current season.
